name: choreographed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
(of an event or course of action) planned very carefully: The campaigns are very choreographed, and they have a message that they want to get out that day. The president's schedule is tightly choreographed.
(of a dance or exercise class) with the combination of movements planned in an exact way: It's like a choreographed dance. Everyone knows what everyone else is doing. Choreographed fitness classes are common in gyms today.
More examplesFewer examplesThe hug was a carefully choreographed maneuver.The apology was part of a choreographed deal to avoid an embarrassing trial. In some ballets there's a lot of space between the steps for you to play around with, but with this one the connecting steps are very choreographed.The latest trend in some clubs was learning the choreographed dance routines of well-known pop artists.
